meanings.definition: To make global or worldwide in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: By connecting people from different countries, we are globalising our community.
meanings.sent2: The company is globalising its products to reach customers worldwide.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the wrong button and ended up globalising my entire document!
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter has a way of globalising joy wherever she goes.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work aims at globalising cultural understanding through visual representation.

meanings.definition: To extend to all or most of the world.
meanings.sent1: The virus quickly spread, globalising the pandemic within weeks.
meanings.sent2: The internet has played a significant role in globalising information sharing.
meanings.sent3: I never expected my cat to be so talented at globalising her napping spots.
meanings.sent4: His groundbreaking invention has the potential to globalise access to clean water.
meanings.sent5: The new technology is globalising communication like never before.

meanings.sent1: As more countries join the trade agreement, they are globalising their economies.
meanings.sent2: The fashion industry is constantly globalising trends across continents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seems to be globalising its nut-burying operations.
meanings.sent4: The idea of sustainability is slowly globalising as environmental awareness grows.
meanings.sent5: The globalising of cultural practices can lead to a rich tapestry of traditions.
